question.title: Monotonic Array
question.content:
An array is monotonic if it is either monotone increasing or monotone decreasing.

An array nums is monotone increasing if for all i <= j, nums[i] <= nums[j]. An array nums is monotone decreasing if for all i <= j, nums[i] >= nums[j].

Given an integer array nums, return true if the given array is monotonic, or false otherwise.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [1,2,2,3]
Output: true

Example 2:

Input: nums = [6,5,4,4]
Output: true

Example 3:

Input: nums = [1,3,2]
Output: false

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 105
  • -105 <= nums[i] <= 105

testcases.explanation: The array is monotone increasing because each element is greater than or equal to the previous one.
The array is monotone decreasing because each element is less than or equal to the previous one.
The array is not monotonic because it is neither monotone increasing nor monotone decreasing.  The sequence goes up (1 to 3) and then down (3 to 2).
